Name: Requiring the dept of social services to provide client service training to certain employees.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of social services to provide client service training to certain employees

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Scheduled by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: This bill was noticed but did not have a Mayoral public hearing on 12-18-2017

History.Description: This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
History.MinutesNote: This bill was returned unsigned on Jan. 5, 2018 (31st Day, Dec. 31, 2017).

Summary: In an effort to improve the level of service provided at social services centers, this bill requires the Human Rights Administration/Department of Social Services to conduct customer service and professionalism training for all employees that interact with members of the public and work in Job Centers or Supplement Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) Centers, where individuals may apply for public assistance benefits.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
       
      Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 21 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 21-140 to read as follows:
                     � 21-140 Client service training. a. Pursuant to subdivision c of this section, the department shall conduct two trainings per year on best practices for improving interactions between department employees and clients of the department.
                     b. Such training shall include techniques to improve professionalism, increase cultural sensitivity and de-escalate conflict.
                     c. The department shall provide such training to all appropriate employees identified by the department whose primary responsibilities include interacting with members of the public in a client service role at any location designated by the department either as a job center where individuals can complete an application for cash assistance in person or as a supplemental nutrition assistance program center.
	d. Nothing in this section shall preclude the department from providing such training to employees other than those identified by the department pursuant to subdivision c of this section.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law.

SSY/AV
LS #8021
11/21/2017,  3:55pm
